ai
Class AIManager

java.lang.Object
  ai.AIManager

public class AIManager
extends java.lang.Object

Class for handling the AI evaluations/situations for various situations.

getDeathCost

public static int getDeathCost(Player player,
                               java.util.LinkedList<Card> handCards)
Returns the value that the player will lose by dying. Can be negative if player gains from death.

Parameters:
player - player to check
handCards - list of the player's hand cards to evaluate; null, if should treat all hand cards as unknown
Returns:
the value that the player will lose by dying; negative if value is gained by dying

getRankedPlayers

public static java.util.LinkedList<Player> getRankedPlayers()
Returns a list of players ranked from those with the highest value (winning) to the lowest value (losing).

Returns:
a list of players starting with the highest valued player (winning) and ending with the lowest valued player (losing)

getCurseCost

public static int getCurseCost(CurseCard card,
                               Player victim,
                               java.util.LinkedList<Card> handCards)
Returns the estimated loss value that the player would suffer from being hit by this curse.

Parameters:
card - the card representing the curse
victim - the player to check
handCards - list of the player's hand cards to evaluate; null, if should treat all hand cards as unknown
Returns:
the estimated loss value that the player would suffer from being hit by this curse; negative if player will gain from curse

getBadStuffCost

public static int getBadStuffCost(MonsterCard monster,
                                  boolean hasMate,
                                  Player player,
                                  boolean isFailedEscape,
                                  java.util.LinkedList<Card> handCards)
Returns the estimated loss value that the player would suffer from trying to escape the monster's "bad stuff". Factors in the chance of escape and any known item cards and abilities.

Parameters:
monster - monster to check
hasMate - whether or not the monster has a mate
player - player to check
isFailedEscape - if player has already failed to escape then bad stuff cost will be the full, inescapable cost
handCards - list of the player's hand cards to evaluate; null, if should treat all hand cards as unknown
Returns:
the estimated loss value that the player would suffer from trying to escape the monster's "bad stuff"

Parameters:
player - p player to check
Returns:
a sorted list of the player's hand cards from least to greatest value

getLeastValuedGPItemList

public static java.util.LinkedList<TreasureCard> getLeastValuedGPItemList(java.util.LinkedList<TreasureCard> allItems,
                                                                          int minGPValue,
                                                                          Player player,
                                                                          java.util.LinkedList<Card> handCards)
Returns a list of items that meets the minimum GP requirement and is worth the least to the player. that meet the minimum GP value.

Parameters:
allItems - the list of items to search
minGPValue - the minimum GP requirement that the list of items must meet
player - player to check
handCards - list of the player's hand cards to evaluate; null, if should treat all hand cards as unknown
Returns:
the list of items that meets the minimum GP requirement and is worth the least to the player

findLeastValuedCardList

private static void findLeastValuedCardList(int currentIdx,
                                            java.util.LinkedList<TreasureCard> items,
                                            int totalGPWorth,
                                            int totalCardWorth)
Recursively searches all the given items to find the least worth combination of items that meet a minimum GP value. All possible combinations will be evaluated and the combination of cards worth the least to the player will set as leastValuedItemList.

Parameters:
currentIdx - the current index of the items to start searching on
items - the current list of items being weighed and evaluated
totalGPWorth - the current total GP value of the evaluated items
totalCardWorth - the current total card worth to owning player of the evaluated items

playHandCard

private static void playHandCard(Player player,
                                 RaceCard raceCard,
                                 int handValue)
Examines the given Race Card and plays it if its value is worth more played than in hand.

Parameters:
player - computer player whose hand will be examined/played
raceCard - Race Card to examine/play
handValue - the value of keeping this card in hand
